intro: Leandra humilis var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves and stems, which give it its specific variety name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
